title: >>> PIE in the EYE
body_text:
The 16th
Wet War
will long be remembered not only for the first hour's constant downpour, but also the heated verbal conflicts between opponents. So much was on the line and neither side had any plans on quitting. Stars came from all over the state for this 81st dodgeball extravaganza and no one was leaving without their weekly dose of dodgeball action. And as the picture shows, for four of dodgeball's most elite superstars, staying clean became the primary goal.
Two feuds rolled into one gigantic match created one of the most insane and competitive dodgeball atmospheres of all-time. Members of the two most recognized families in the history of the game looked to conquer perhaps their biggest rivals when
Valerie Winston
and
Kevin Adams
squared-off against the agile and powerful combination of
Lenny Herrera
and
John Tronolone
. The stakes couldn't have been any higher as one team would leave creamed ... literally. What a way to kick off Season 9 with the  first-ever
CREAMation Rules
match!
Quick Match Results
It was a brutal outing for Lenny and John. Not only were they drenched from head to toe, but they had lost the first four consecutive games of LXXXI. The score looked grim for the hungry duo, but neither man was ready to give up on the opportunity to literally cream their rival team. Would the next game see a turn-around?
There would be no shut-out victory for Team VK, having been beaten in the 5th game of this historical series; Team LJ was finally on the board. But Game 5 proved to be nothing more than a fluke as Team VK went on to win the next two games, taking a huge lead in this all-or-nothing confrontation.
Though Team LJ picked up Games 8 and 9, it was a little too late for any retaliation.
Co-captains Kevin Adams & Valerie Winston had defeated Co-captains John Tronolone & Lenny Herrera, 6 - 3, in the first-ever
CREAMation Rules
match at DODGEBALL LXXXI.
And of course as per the pre-match stipulation, the losers paid the ultimate price; a pie in the eye!
Exclusive DODGEBALL LXXXI "CREAMation" Video!
"DODGEBALL LXXXI was truly a spectacular event. The weather was wild, the competition was fierce, and the ending was unforgettable. Nothing will ever top the experience of 'creamating' Lenny in the face."
- KEVIN ADAMS
Moments & Stars
: Ray Marzarella's consistant blocking and overall longevity, Sascha Basista's wicked sliding-dodge, the returning Ryan Letsche's all-around performance, the athletic stars from Seton Hall, Valerie Winston pelted in the ear by Tom Adams
Online Exclusive!
Herrera/Tronolone vs. Adams/Winston
was actually planned a good 3 weeks in advance, obviously agreed upon by all the participants. In the final week leading up to the showdown, Lenny, John, and Kevin all agreed to add pudding to the pies. Valerie however voted against this and thus the idea was scrapped.
And of course ... the LXXXI Records
> Attendance: 31
> Biggest Return: Wesley Hebrew (Last appearance at DODGEBALL LIX)
> New Players: (6) Tom Holowka, Matt Ruggeri, Jason Cosma, Chris Dutra, Melissa Green, Phil Lewis
- This is the first attendance over 30 since DODGEBALL 71 in early January.
- DODGEBALL LXXXI was
Wet War XVI
as well as the second consecutive
Wet War
. It was the inaugural event of the Spring 2007 season.
- DODGEBALL LXXXI hosted the first-ever
CREAMation Rules
match where the losing team captains would be hit in the face with a whipped cream filled pie. It was contested under traditional rules for the entire duration [ending at 10:36pm].
- Kevin Adams became only the second captain in history to win 5 matches, tying the record with his older brother Chris. Kevin is also the first player to win two team battles, having also won at DODGEBALL 50. John Tronolone became the second player to captain a team 9 times, tying this record with Chris Adams. In the process, he became the first competitor to lose his 6th match. After LXXXI, Kevin is 5-2-0, Valerie is 3-2-2, Lenny is 3-3-1, and John is 3-6-0.
- And on a final note, DODGEBALL LXXXI fell on The Undertaker's birthday; John Tronolone's favorite WWE wrestler.
Thanks!
Thanks to one Lenny Herrera for the use of his camera to catch the aftermath footage. Alison Bertsch is also thanked as she did the camera work during the
CREAMations
themselves.
body_html:
The 16th Wet War will long be remembered not only for the first hour's constant downpour, but also the heated verbal conflicts between opponents. So much was on the line and neither side had any plans on quitting. Stars came from all over the state for this 81st dodgeball extravaganza and no one was leaving without their weekly dose of dodgeball action. And as the picture shows, for four of dodgeball's most elite superstars, staying clean became the primary goal.


Two feuds rolled into one gigantic match created one of the most insane and competitive dodgeball atmospheres of all-time. Members of the two most recognized families in the history of the game looked to conquer perhaps their biggest rivals when Valerie Winston and Kevin Adams squared-off against the agile and powerful combination of Lenny Herrera and John Tronolone. The stakes couldn't have been any higher as one team would leave creamed ... literally. What a way to kick off Season 9 with the first-ever CREAMation Rules match!

Quick Match Results
It was a brutal outing for Lenny and John. Not only were they drenched from head to toe, but they had lost the first four consecutive games of LXXXI. The score looked grim for the hungry duo, but neither man was ready to give up on the opportunity to literally cream their rival team. Would the next game see a turn-around?

There would be no shut-out victory for Team VK, having been beaten in the 5th game of this historical series; Team LJ was finally on the board. But Game 5 proved to be nothing more than a fluke as Team VK went on to win the next two games, taking a huge lead in this all-or-nothing confrontation.

Though Team LJ picked up Games 8 and 9, it was a little too late for any retaliation.

Co-captains Kevin Adams & Valerie Winston had defeated Co-captains John Tronolone & Lenny Herrera, 6 - 3, in the first-ever CREAMation Rules match at DODGEBALL LXXXI.

And of course as per the pre-match stipulation, the losers paid the ultimate price; a pie in the eye!
Exclusive DODGEBALL LXXXI "CREAMation" Video!

"DODGEBALL LXXXI was truly a spectacular event. The weather was wild, the competition was fierce, and the ending was unforgettable. Nothing will ever top the experience of 'creamating' Lenny in the face."
- KEVIN ADAMS

Moments & Stars: Ray Marzarella's consistant blocking and overall longevity, Sascha Basista's wicked sliding-dodge, the returning Ryan Letsche's all-around performance, the athletic stars from Seton Hall, Valerie Winston pelted in the ear by Tom Adams

Online Exclusive!
Herrera/Tronolone vs. Adams/Winston was actually planned a good 3 weeks in advance, obviously agreed upon by all the participants. In the final week leading up to the showdown, Lenny, John, and Kevin all agreed to add pudding to the pies. Valerie however voted against this and thus the idea was scrapped.

And of course ... the LXXXI Records
> Attendance: 31
> Biggest Return: Wesley Hebrew (Last appearance at DODGEBALL LIX)
> New Players: (6) Tom Holowka, Matt Ruggeri, Jason Cosma, Chris Dutra, Melissa Green, Phil Lewis

- This is the first attendance over 30 since DODGEBALL 71 in early January.
- DODGEBALL LXXXI was Wet War XVI as well as the second consecutive Wet War. It was the inaugural event of the Spring 2007 season.
- DODGEBALL LXXXI hosted the first-ever CREAMation Rules match where the losing team captains would be hit in the face with a whipped cream filled pie. It was contested under traditional rules for the entire duration [ending at 10:36pm].
- Kevin Adams became only the second captain in history to win 5 matches, tying the record with his older brother Chris. Kevin is also the first player to win two team battles, having also won at DODGEBALL 50. John Tronolone became the second player to captain a team 9 times, tying this record with Chris Adams. In the process, he became the first competitor to lose his 6th match. After LXXXI, Kevin is 5-2-0, Valerie is 3-2-2, Lenny is 3-3-1, and John is 3-6-0.
- And on a final note, DODGEBALL LXXXI fell on The Undertaker's birthday; John Tronolone's favorite WWE wrestler.

Thanks!
Thanks to one Lenny Herrera for the use of his camera to catch the aftermath footage. Alison Bertsch is also thanked as she did the camera work during the CREAMations themselves.
